results.title: Exile in Sarajevo
results.creator_credit: Alma Sahbaz, Tahir Cambis, Tom Zubrycki and Exile Productions
results.brief_description: A passionate and personal account of the siege of Sarajevo, from the viewpoint of Bosnian-Australian Tahir Cambis and Sarajevan, Alma Sahbaz. The directors encapsulate wider tragedies within two unfolding narratives. Nirvan, a talented young dancer, dies after a shelling attack. Her family, unable to come to terms with their loss, is forced to leave Sarajevo as refugees bound for America. Eight year old Amira’s illustrated diary is poignant testimony of the murder of family and friends. Both stories are set within the context of NATO bombing missions, UN Press Conferences and the liberation and reunification of parts of the city under Bosnian-Serb control. Cambis and Sahbaz the filmmakers become Cambis and Sahbaz the subjects. The grief of people around Cambis resonates with his own mother’s flight from Sarajevo in the 1950’s, forcing him to examine his own cultural inheritance. Anguished, enraged, even funny at times, ‘Exile in Sarajevo’ is an elegy for a city where Serbs, Bosnians and Croats still live in harmony, ignoring the myth of ethnic hatred. Edited by Bill Murphy, photographed by Roman Baska, Tahir Cambis and Alma Sahbaz.

results.title: Exile and the kingdom (A)
results.creator_credit: Frank Rijavec, Noelene Harrison and Ngurin Aboriginal Corporation
results.brief_description: Roger Solomon, an Aboriginal from the north of Western Australia, narrates this history of the tribes from the Fortescue River area, who have been forced into coastal ghettoes, specifically in Roebourne, as a result of government policies, lack of work and the encroachment of mining interests. This removal from their tribal lands has led to their current problems which Solomon and the elders of the tribe would like to solve by a return to their homelands and tribal law. The video is in two parts.

results.title: Exhibition formally known as Synthetics (EFKS)
results.brief_description: An exhibition that charts the history of the electronically generated image in Australia from 1969 - 1988 (roughly). Includes case studies by artists whose creative innovations have influenced significantly the evolution of electronic media arts. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Exhaustion exposure
results.brief_description: Deals with the causes of exhaustion exposure. Covers such topics as: food intake; mixed ability walking groups; producing, losing and controlling body heat; emergency procedure when in the mountains. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Exfoliative cytologic method in the diagnosis of gastric cancer
results.brief_description: Shows how early diagnostic methods of detecting uterine and vaginal cancer in early 1940s have been applied to development of a technique using a gastric balloon to obtain tissue and blood samples to isolate gastric malignancy. Expert comment at conclusion suggests findings have been significant by this method.

results.title: Exeter
results.creator_credit: Gerald Budner, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Exeter Cathedral in Devonshire, England, is considered to be the finest example of architecture of the Decorated period, 1250-1350. This film rolls back the centuries, unfolding the cathedral’s history, showing the refinement of the sculpture that went into its building, from the airy vista of the nave (longest unbroken stretch of Gothic vaulting in the world), to the vibrant colors of its windows. But more than architecture survives, Exeter is still a living church for the people of today. Credits include: photography by Pierre Letarte, Reginald Morris, Richard Todd, Gilles Gascon; editing by Margaret Wescott; music by The Dunstable Consort; sound by Ted Haley, Jean-Guy Normandin and Peter Hearn.

results.title: Exercise Musk-ox
results.creator_credit: E Scythes, Douglas Wilkinson, Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A journey of scientific exploration through Canada’s north. Members of the Canadian Army, with snowmobiles and amphibious weasel, made a great winter trek over country never before travelled by motor vehicle. The expedition took detailed weather observations, corrected maps, studied the mobility of snow vehicles, and coped with the weather. Through human skill and endurance the frontier of the north was pushed back, showing its rich promise for the future.

results.title: Exercise green!
results.creator_credit: Terry Ohlsson, Philip Bond and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: A simulated full scale military, naval and air force assault exercise from planning through victualling, sappers’ engineering, parachuting and shelling followed by a computer analysis of the entire operation.

results.title: Exercise Beats Arthritis
results.brief_description: Regular exercise helps you to gain some control over your arthritis and take responsibility for yourself. Working with this video, you can begin to plan your own exercise program, building exercise and activity into your daily life. Learn how to relax too, so you can release built-up tension and calm your mind. Valerie Sayce is a physiotherapist who specialises in exercise programs for people with arthritis. She works at the Arthritis Foundation of Victoria as a Physical Activities educator.

results.title: Excursion to the bridge of friendship
results.brief_description: A sophisticated Sydney woman gets back to her cultural roots in this wonderful black and white musical tale of female bonding and Bulgarian folk singers. Christina Andreef packs this joyful short with plenty of spirit as it briskly reinvents and updates the classic Hollywood movie musical maxim of ‘putting on a show’.
